result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah L Mastaglio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah L Mastaglio

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarah L Mastaglio in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez and Michael Forella in court for Sarah L Mastaglio. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 21CF08 Cts 2, 3 & 4- NO CONTEST. 
22CF434 Cts 1, 2 & 3- NO CONTEST. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: 21CF08 Cts 2, 3 & 4 GUILTY with Ct 1 being dismissed and read in. 22CF434 Cts 1, 2 & 3 GUILTY with remaining counts dismissed and read in. 22CF278 will be dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
21CF08-
Ct 2-
2 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 1 year initial confinement with 1 year extended supervision imposed and stayed on each count to run concurrent if revoked.  
2 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
120 days STAYED. 
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored accordingly.
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling as may be feasible with social security. 
No contact with the victim.
No contact with any known drug dealers or users. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is eligible for CIP
Defendant is eligible for SAP. 

22CF434- Time served sentence. 
Firearm warning. Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Mandatory Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge, payment plan $25/month commending 10/1/2022.

8:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarah L Mastaglio in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Sarah L Mastaglio. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Atty Ramirez requests to address the bond motions on 22CF434 & 21CF08 and gives statement as to that request. 
State objects to modification and gives statement. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Denied.
Bail/bond hearing on July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

9:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarah L Mastaglio in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Sarah L Mastaglio. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense moves to modify bond to lower cash or high signature bond. Defense requests a plea and sentencing. 
State objects with argument.
BTC: Motion to modify bond denied. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:39 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarah L Mastaglio in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Sarah L Mastaglio. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense indicates defendant has picked up a new file, that needs to go trhough prelim. the 2CF278 file is a conflict for counsel and he cannot represent defendant in it. Requests bond be renstated.
State objects to bind reinstatement, requests additional cash. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Bonds to be reinstated, with an additional $500 cash each file. Matters set to track with prelim in 22CF434
Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarah L Mastaglio appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter in court for Sarah L Mastaglio. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
